text: Holy Trinity Church, Yeaveley is a Grade II listed parish church in the Church of England in Yeaveley, Derbyshire. ==History== The foundation stone was laid on 8 August 1839 by Revd. W. A. Shirley. and the church opened in 1840. It was built of red brick in Flemish bond with sone and moulded brick dressings. ==Parish status== The church is in a joint parish with *All Saints' Church, Brailsford *St James' Church, Edlaston *St Martin's Church, Osmaston *St Michael's Church, Shirley ==References== Yeaveley Yeaveley
title: Holy Trinity Church, Yeaveley
